comment: Took her for Math 1111. Syllabus was strict, seemed rude. Everything was in ALEKS. Not allowed retakes. Wouldn't open back up assignments if missed. Replaced your final with 1 missing test grade. No extra credit. Tests were hard, study. Tons of ALEKS HW. HW grades barely improved my grade. Tests were lockdown and webcam. Wouldn't take again.

Great prof. Replaced lowest test score with the final, had study guide for final. She answered very quickly always. She was extremely helpful. She added points onto tests where she felt you were close to the answer. Tests were lockdown webcam but they were never too hard. They matched the homework. Super easy A.

She is the worst professor I have ever taken. She told us if we knew the study guide, we would be good. No! The study guide is 40+ pages and the tests are harder than the concepts. DO NOT TAKE HER. And she is extremely rude. I tried asking her for help, and she was making me feel bad for not knowing...but that is the whole point of office hours.

I took this as a summer course, so there were about three homework assignments and a test or quiz every week. I emailed Professor Rushton a couple of times and always got a response. Everything is on Pearson My Lab Math, so you are essentially teaching yourself the material (w/ a textbook). Easy if you have a good Algebra 1 & 2 background.

This teacher has not uploaded ANYTHING. She has given us textbook chapters to read that do not match up with the homework assignments. She has the gall to force us to take proctored tests when she cannot even upload a SINGLE lecture. I asked how to do a specific problem and was just told to use a calculator. STAY AWAY!!!!

This professor is completed unengaged with her class. At the beginning of the semester she gives you a link to a self-teaching math website and some discussions where other students answer your questions instead of her. If you are not outstanding at math and need some guidance from a professor, do NOT take this course.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Clear grading criteria

comment: Professor Rushton is a really nice lady, however if you are someone who is not all that skilled or has had trouble with math classes in the past, I do not recommend. Unfortunately, I did not know about this site before taking her, but she isn't all that accessible and doesn't offer much help to her students. The final exam is super heavy as well.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--Tough grader

comment: she is the most unhelpful professor I have ever encountered out of 4 years of being in college. if you dont understand something, just hope and pray that there is a video online for it or you somehow receive a miracle because she does not help AT ALL. and when I say at all, I mean LITERALLY NO HELP AT ALL for ANY concepts. take SOMEONE ELSE!

She is the WORST math professor She gave us study guides and told us if we knew it, we would pass Not True The questions had NOTHING to do with the tests. It was harder. If you are struggling with math, do NOT take her. I am not a slacker, I am willing to put in the work, but she was just not a good teacher. If you do not know math, you will fail.

Mrs. Rushton expects the most from her students but contributes the least when it comes to answering email, putting in grades, and overall being present with her students. All the work is done through Aleks that caused a cycle of stress and headache to understand the material. Do you and your mental health a favor and find a different professor.

Rushton is very uninvolved and does not care! We have weekly homework and discussions and tests every other week. If you have any technical difficulties that negatively affect your test she does nothing to solve it or give you a 2nd chance. She does not always respond to emails. She does not teach. You have to do every single thing on your own.

The class itself is very easy, but she is not involved at all. We have several discussions with strict requirements and she never participates in them. She takes forever to email back. And we could NOT use scratch paper on the proctored final, and you really need it to pass. The final almost caused me to go down a whole letter grade.

The best math professor I've ever had. In fact, her MATH 1101 class was not my first attempt at MATH 1101. I had previously tried to take other MATH 1101 classes only to later withdraw. Her class, however, was the MATH 1101 class that I finally passed. Follow the course pacing guide she provides, do the homework and discussions, and you can pass.

She's very uninvolved but if you email her she is very helpful. I liked her very clear expectations and the tests are easier than the homework. With that said you will have homework 1-2 times a week and there are discussion posts (very easy) for each homework. If you take her make sure you post 2 discussion posts atleast 12 hours apart to get 100's
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework--Test heavy

comment: I took her class online and honestly her class was self explanatory when it came to assignments but she was definitely not involved through out the whole semester. She does have us do weekly discussions and we pretty much ask each other how to do the homework. If your good at teaching yourself take her class. I did not mind how involved she was .
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: She is completely uninvolved. Be prepared to teach yourself. I would recommend taking another professor if you can.

Didnt know how to rate her because shes very uninvolved in class. Its pretty much a self taught class and I know a lot of my classmates struggled with that. I didnt do horribly, but I definitely could have used some guidance to understand the concepts more. Theres extra credit for the final
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Clear grading criteria--EXTRA CREDIT
